abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Rice Productivity
            Improvement Project for Lao People's Democratic
            Republic (Lao PDR) is to increase rice productivity and
            overall volume of rice production among smallholders in
            selected provinces, thereby increasing incomes and improving
            food security for small farm households. The project was
            approved on January 13, 2009 and was processed under the
            Global Food Crisis Response Program in the amount of US$3
            million. The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to
            increase rice productivity and overall volume of rice
            production among smallholders in selected provinces, thereby
            increasing incomes and improving food security for small
            farm households. After initial implementation difficulties,
            the current progress towards achievement of PDO and
            implementation progress are being upgraded to Marginally
            Satisfactory following the implementation support mission
            held in November 2011. The project has produced significant
            amounts of seed, and the use of good seed has contributed
            significantly to increasing rice yields and the total
            production volume of rice. The availability of improved seed
            is helping farmers increase rice productivity and the
            overall volume of production. The project objectives remain
            relevant and achievable. The changes have no impact on the
            PDO, results/ indicators, scope of project components,
            project institutional arrangements, safeguards, disbursement
            and fiduciary arrangements. The borrower has prepared an
            action plan satisfactory to the Bank to complete the project.
